page.title: 07 ANTLER LUGGAGE
page.content:
The{Antler Luggage}factory is situated close to Lower Gigg on the East side of{Bury.}The company is housed in a large one-time cotton mill, and has established a world-wide reputation. The mill was empty for some years before it was taken over by{Antler}in the early 1970's. It was used as a warehouse for the C.W.S. but was closed as more and more Co-op shops shut in the Bury area. During the Second World War the factory was used for making munitions. In common with many other textile factories in this area it is a good example of a change of use to new consumer based industries.
St. Thomas's C.E. Primary.
